headline: Dr. Oz And Herschel Walker Asked By White House To Step Down Or Be Fired, Both Were Trump Appointees
author: Joseph Gobran
sentences: The White House requested Dr. Mehmet Oz and Herschel Walker, who are now Republican Senate candidates in Pennsylvania and Georgia, respectively, to step down from their positions as the administration forbids federal candidates to be members of presidential boards.
President Biden is so scared about us beating Raphael Warnock that he has asked me to resign from my unpaid position on the President’s Council on Sports, Fitness, and Nutrition.

pic.twitter.com/fJaVLKVWOC
— Dr. Mehmet Oz (@DrOz) March 24, 2022
The letter from Raghavan reads: "Please submit your resignation to me by the close of business today.
The Biden administration has officially called on two members of the President's Council on Sports, Fitness and Nutrition to step down or face termination.
Dr. Oz posted a video that shows the letter, which was signed by Gautam Raghavan, the deputy director of the White House Presidential Personnel Office.
I received this letter on behalf of @POTUS requesting I resign from the President's Council on Sports, Fitness & Nutrition.
Former President Donald Trump reappointed the celebrity doctor and former NFL player to two-year terms in December 2020.
Should we not receive your resignation, your position with the Council will be terminated effective 6:00 p.m.
The doctor he should ask to resign is Dr. Fauci, for a multitude of obvious reasons.
In the video, Dr. Oz said he won't step down, citing the politicization of health.

Let Americans see how truly petty and political he truly is.”
At 11:26 a.m.
It’s sad that he would politicize such an important issue like health.
“If President Biden wants to politicize health, he'll have to fire me.
Both Dr. Oz and Walker have never served as elected officials.
— Herschel Walker (@HerschelWalker) March 24, 2022
I’m not a quitter so you are going to have to fire me.
ET, Walker posted on Twitter that he will not resign.
"I've got no intentions, my friends, of resigning.
None," said Dr. Oz.
tonight."
